title: Were the Philistines originally from the island of Crete, or were they from Palestine? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi Andy, we know very little about ancient Philistine genetics. It has only been recently that a Philistine cemetery has been discovered and very few skeletons from it have been sequenced for DNA. The results are showing a local population with transient South European admixture but it is unclear where the minor European elements is coming from. Most likely from the Western Mediterranean because it brought some Western Hunter-Gatherer ancestry to the Middle East which is almost nonexistent in Greece but research is ongoing. You can read about this piece of research here: Ancient DNA sheds light on the genetic origins of early Iron Age Philistines Additionally, you can see a previous answer I’ve written to a similar question: Ral Cheva's answer to If the Philistines were transplanted Minoans, how come they didn't continue the civilization of the Minoans?

“Were the Philistines originally from the island of Crete, or were they from Palestine?” No one knows for certain where the Philistines came from, but it is known that they were a Greek people not native to the coastal Middle East region that became known as the Land of the Philistines. So any now existing people who claim to be descendants of the Philistines are of Greek origin, not Middle Eastern.

They were a group that came in by boat (called the sea people by their contemporaries) that were unrelated to the Canaanite or Semite cultures of the area. Where they came from and who they are related to is unknown. It is theorized by many that they are related to the Minoans, but the evidence is lacking.

The Philistines were actually greek-oriented, from Crete or other islands in the Mediterranean. The term Palestine was coined many years after the Philistines disappeared, to denote a geographic area. This area includes Jordan, The Palestinian Authority, Hamas-led Gaza strip, and Israel.

They are from Mizrayim founder of Egypt, during the lifetime of Abraham they moved to the Land of Shem aka Land of Israel, Gaza area, during first dynasty Egypt. Later some Captorim, that were related to them, joined them, perhaps from Cypress or Crete or..reference the YeC Moshe Emes series for Torah and science alignment.
